results.title: This nuclear age
results.creator_credit: Sally Macdonald, Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Since the first film was made explaining the power of the atom, nuclear technology has made great advances. This film is an up-to-date account of the many areas of nuclear research and recent developments in Canada. It was filmed at the long-functioning atomic reactors at Chalk River and Rolphton, and at the latest and largest atomic power station at Pickering, as well as at laboratories across the land where experimentation is carried out in both pure and applied nuclear science.

results.title: This model age
results.brief_description: Shows the skill and ingenuity involved in making radio-controlled, diesel-engined and electric-powered toy models. The models range from conventional aircraft, trains and boats to futuristic transport designed for space exploration

results.title: This matter of motivation
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: A series of seven films on motivation based on original material developed by the Caterpillar Tractor Company from the concepts of Frederick Herzberg. Teaches the effectiveness of behavioural science motivation techniques. Covers specific personnel problems by means of case studies.;”CONTENTS: 1. The basic instructional film. 28 min. - 2. The puzzle. 6 min. - 3. The roadblock. 6 min. - 4. The gilded lilly. 5 min. - 5. The pacesetter. 6 min. - 6. The nice guy. 4 min. - 7. The ball of fire. 4 min.”

results.title: This marching girl thing
results.creator_credit: Kelli Simpson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Cindy (Toni Collette), a baton twirler with the Southern Twirlettes is competing in the Victorian Baton Twirlers competition, her girlfriend Alison (Jenny Apostolou), and boyfriend Peter (Matt Day) in tow. As the results are announced, she questions whether she should continue pursuing “this marching girl thing”, and whether she should continue with Alison or Peter.

results.title: This man
results.creator_credit: Keith Laxton, J.N. Bagnall and Australian Board of Missions
results.brief_description: This film is about the impact of Western culture on the people of the Pacific. It tells of the Melanesian’s loss of a sense of identity and meaning, and the disappearance of the old ways that gave happiness and security. It is often angry and bitter, but is not without hope, for the man of Melanesia is determined to find the way out of his confusion and despair. Based on a Melanesian play by Francis Bugotu and Tony Hughes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Laxton, J.N. Bagnall and Australian Board of Missions

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Luci Clark, South Australian Film Corporation and Newfilms
results.brief_description: Carcass classification has taken much of the guesswork out of pig marketing. As a more objective measure in assessing the quality of the pork, classification is better for both producer and consumer. Explains the benefits to the farmer, and the way modern computers program and store production details. Cast includes Brian Moore, Flo Watson, Peter Brechin, Darcy Button, Keith Arnfield.

results.title: This little pig went to market
results.brief_description: In 1912, Dandy Hams and Bacon commenced at premises located in Dandenong, Melbourne. This short film is a rare record of Dandenong’s first major industry and features reminiscences by Maurie Jarvis (filmmaker Sue Jarvis’s father) who worked at Dandy from the age of 15 until he retired, first as a truck driver and then as a Sales Manager. Now aged 86 Maurie remembers quite fondly of his time at the Dandy Bacon Factory and talks about its operations and processes to a background of rare archival images of the factory buildings, its machinery and its workers. Sadly none of these buildings now exist.

results.title: This life
results.brief_description: ‘This life’ - the series following the life and loves of twenty something solicitors, Anna, Miles, Milly, Egg and Warren earned itself a legion of loyal fans when it originally screened in 1997. Series devised by Amy Jenkins.
